subject: RE: [junit] Why doesn't JUnit count asserts?
msgSnippet: I don t think that was the point.  The point was that Matthew (& co.) are using JUnit for both UTs and ATs (FTs).  JUnit is actually very good for some types
messageBody:
I don't think that was the point. The point was that Matthew (& co.) are
using JUnit for both UTs and ATs (FTs). JUnit is actually very good for
some types of ATs because it is such a well designed automated testing
framework. They aren't violating any premises, for as Matthew said they are
using it for UTs in the way it was meant. But, if it happens to work for
their ATs, why not use it?

If you would still like to get into the debate of what is a "UNIT" though,
feel free.

-Jason
